dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHACK (GUAJIRA PENINSULA, COLOMBIA) - CROCKETT - DAWN A lantern lights his face.  The night is soft.  Crockett's with a couple of campesinos, playing poker and drinking beer. Whoever's shack this is, is a Tupac Shakur freak.  His image is on all the walls.  A diesel truck starts and pulls away outside. EXT. LANDING STRIP - TUBBS - NIGHT checking the cargo tie-downs inside an A-500 Adam aircraft. He's sweating.  His shirt's off.  The cargo is ten black plastic-wrapped and taped bundles.  Like any good pilot, Tubbs trusts nobody but himself to tie-down the load.  The rear seats are removed.  There's a plastic bladder holding a reserve of 50 gallons of AvGas. INT. SHACK - CROCKETT wins.  The girls shriek.  Crockett pushes the money towards the Campesinos.  They refuse.  Crockett insists.  One will
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 0-seven-six-Nellie-Charlie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Opa-Locka.  What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got an Aero Commander coming in on a two-seventy-nine heading, but I had a double image...like there's another plane there, now I'm only picking up on one.  What do you read? INT. US CUSTOMS AWAC - RADAR OFFICER RADAR OFFICER Let me see... His FLIR (Forward Looking Infrared) picks up Switek and Zito's Air Commander.  He flips through all the different modalities of detection, including thermography, for anything else suspicious in the airspace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into mic) Too many Mai Tais at lunch... You're seeing double.  One blip. One plane. EXT. SKY - SIDE SHOT:  THE AERO COMMANDER LIKE A PANCAKE ON TOP OF THE A-500 RIGHT BELOW IT We get the joke.  The A-500 with its stealthiness under the Aero Commander together like a single footprint. AERIAL ANGLE:  TWO PLANES piggybacked, enter US airspace and cross the coastline into Florida. From underneath, the Aero Commander sweeps to the right on approach as Tubbs radically dives for the trees, hugging the contour at 220 knots at 150 feet...having snuck this plane and its load into the United States of America.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: ON TOP OF THE A-500 RIGHT BELOW IT
result.heading: ON TOP OF THE A-500 RIGHT BELOW IT

direction.raw_text: : EXT. CIRCLE 6 MOTEL, PARKING LOT - U-HAUL-IT TRUCK - NIGHT Alone in the acid-yellow glare of the sodium vapor lights. We wait.  We don't know why we're here. PARKING LOT PERIMETER - SAWGRASS MOVE IN...and we REVEAL staked-out are Crockett, Jean-Louis and Tubbs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neptune gonna show? We don't know who he's talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he'll show.  This is his kind of deal.  Crime on crime.  Who's gonna call the cops?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (skeptical) Usually his thing is street dealers.  Torture their families until they cough up the stash. This...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's ambitious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heads up... ESCALADE Lights off.  Cruises through the parking lot past the U-Haul- It to the other side and disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's slick:  Neptune's Escalade's worth more than the real estate. But no one's supposed to notice his drive-by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's another incognito genius... ANOTHER ANGLE:  MALIBU SS cruises the other end of the parking lot.  The Escalade returns.  All's clear.  Both converge around the U-Haul-It truck.  Out of the Escalade steps NEPTUNE - 6'4", narrow- shouldered and bald.  From the Malibu and back of the Escalade, Four more Haitian ZO POUNDERS with handguns, shotguns and shades... NEPTUNE pops the lock on the U-Haul-It with a crowbar.  He rolls up the door expecting millions worth of cocaine.  Instead he comes face to face with the barrel of a 12-gauge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: April Fool, motherfucker. Trudy whips the butt end of the shotgun around, caving in Neptune's cheekbone and nose... WIDER - NEPTUNE goes down for the count.  Switek - under the truck - rolls out.  Crockett, Tubbs with shotguns, Jean-Louis and Zito with CAR-15s emerge from the perimeter with bright lights on shouting for the Haitians to freeze...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Patois) Arrete!  Arrete!  Freeze! (to one) Et vous, mo-fo! A 250-lb. ZO POUNDER brings up his weapon.  Crockett BLOWS the guy's legs out from under him.  Zito disarms him.  The other two are disarmed. NEPTUNE is rolled over by Crockett.  He plastic-ties his wrists and feet.  Others are manhandled...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in French) Get the fuck in the truck...! Zo Pounders, plastic-tied, are thrown into the truck with the thousand kilos of cocaine.  But not Neptune.  The gate is rolled down and padlocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Client got delivery.  But there were..."extras" in the back of the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Extras" tried to relieve us of your weight... (beat) And by the by, you know of a player in Overtown who goes by the name of "Things Aquatic"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.  We don't do business with him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to..."do business"...with you.  Around ten.  His place.  Be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be there. EXT. OVERTOWN STREET - JOSE YERO IN A TINTED EXCURSION - DAY cruises storefront churches, chacouteries, Baptist missions, Haitian restaurants and palm trees.  Men in dark trousers and white shirts lean in doorways.  The SUV preceding Yero stops three houses before us.  The Excursion with Yero stops two houses beyond.  Security - very casually - deploys.  NOW, Yero approaches...seen through the curtains of the window we're looking through.  Reveal Tubbs watching. And, he crosses to the door and opens it as Yero cautiously enters. INT. LIVING ROOM - YERO And his face registers surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look familiar? DOPE Carefully stacked in the living room are the PLASTIC-WRAPPED BRICKS OF COCAINE THAT CROCKETT AND TUBBS STOLE FROM SAL MAGUDA'S WAREHOUSE WHEN THEY BLEW UP HIS BOATS. Hog-tied and bleeding all over his clothes, in the corner is Neptune.  His mouth is taped.  He's shaking his head...disclaiming, disowning and disavowing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This the load you lost a while back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is.  He try to take tonight's load?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do I do with him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Whatever you want.  Like we said, we're not into violence. Yero looks around the corner and sees Switek and Zito in the dining room, casually at ease with Galil assault rifles...meaning "don't even think about it"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suspicious) I walk into Neptune's house...very nice.  But I also see you... and our drugs that got ripped from Maguda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like us finding your load?  We can go and lose it all over again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout this?  How'd Neptune know where to hit us?  Huh?  Whose Op sec's got a leak?  Yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd Neptune tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't.  Interrogation's not in our skill set. (beat) So c'mon, what suspicions have you master-minded off these associations?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers in Spanish to Isabella) Here's what this is...ask how much they want to turn back to us our load... Yero's certain about their motive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the recovery?  How much are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Crockett) How much we looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's "nothing"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.  As in "free, gratis."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as an investment in the future...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes off her glasses and looks at Crockett) "Future" of...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fine...business...relationship... She holds Crockett's look...as she did before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's yours cause what's yours, is yours.  And what's ours is ours... (to Yero) ...like the second ten-percent, which is now due, Yero, my ace. Isabella gestures.  Yero kicks across the floor a cardboard box full of money.  Tubbs glances inside.  Doesn't count it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up next?  Or is this a one- time deal? Isabella decides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Yero) Give them the shipment on the seventeenth... Yero doesn't like it.  She gestures "do it."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conveyance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maritime.  Jose will fill you in. And she starts to leave...and sensing Crockett's gotten up and follows her.  Meanwhile
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Yero) Lay it out... And Crockett, close behind Isabella, now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) There is one thing you can do for me in recognition of the death- defying risks we took to recover your product...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) And what is that? This is the wife of narcotrafficker Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me buy you a drink. Isabella pauses.  Crockett may get killed right now.  They're near the open doors to the patio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) What do you like to drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) I'm a fiend for mojitas. Isabella looks over at Crockett's boat.  Back to Crockett...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) How fast does that go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It goes very fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me...? Isabella and Crockett head outside towards the dock, Tubbs overtakes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I talk to you for a second, partner...? They step aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low, re:  Isabella) Wha's up...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) I know what I'm doing. And he leaves to help Isabella board.  Switek unties and pushes off the boat.  Looking out the window at them is Jose Yero, as perplexed as Tubbs, who covers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...secure satellite comms. encrypted e-mail, the longs and lats for the transshipment point...all that?  It's all cool. But I need a vector, not a location.  'Cause ships move. That's why they call them ships. Ship stops?  It's trying to be an apartment building.  At sea that attracts attention.  That's bad... Meanwhile... INT. STRYKER, CABIN - CROCKETT + ISABELLA pulling away from the docks at 12 knots, repressing the thunder of the 2,700-horsepower engines.  Crockett leaves the canopy slid back.  They're open to the air.  He gives Isabella headsets so they can talk over the roar.  The wind starts to move her hair.  She's not sure how to put on the headset. Crockett lets the boat rock over the swells while he arranges her headset around her ears.  His fingers brush her hair, touch her skin... It was not intentional.  But the look in Crockett's eyes is as if a small voltage passed through him. He plugs her headset into the dash, regains the wheel, shoves the throttles forward and... EXT. OPEN OCEAN - "BORN TO WIN" cuts and then leaps over swells.  In seven seconds they're doing over 70 knots.  And Crockett holds it there as... ISABELLA The wind whips her hair behind her, now.  The two are small against the smooth 50' long hull.  Crockett hands her wraparound shades for her eyes.  She doesn't want them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through headset) So where's the best place for mojitas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bodeguita del Medio.  It's the only place for mojitas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off a little alley with cobblestones.  Hemingway went there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Keys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Havana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Havana?  Cubans don't like us or my business...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you afraid? (smiles; Crockett shakes his head "no") Good.  And you don't need a visa. Cause you're with me. EXT. OPEN OCEAN - OVERHEAD "BORN TO WIN" - DAY rockets from one swell to the next, getting airborne.  Wind and salt electrify Isabella.  She turns to Crockett and smiles, putting on the glasses, now.  Crockett gestures to her knees.  She should keep them bent.  Crockett pushes it to 75 knots... FRONTAL:  CROCKETT + ISABELLA in strong light, ripped by wind.  Behind them are ocean and sky and twenty-foot plumes which jet from the props and make a wake that vectors in diagonals to what each is leaving behind them...where they've been...and converge to push them to the new places where they're headed.  Behind, the skies are leaden.  They're racing a storm.  Sunlight shafts through a gap in thunderclouds, turning the clouds yellow.  Now, they turn peach against the darkening open water and the grey sky behind.  The boat vibrates, the engines scream and... CROCKETT waves her over to join him behind the wheel.  He holds out his left hand to steady her.  He brings her to him.  Both lean against his high upholstered chair.  He holds her to his side.  Indicates the wheel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Light touch.  Everything comes to you through the wheel. CROCKETT stays on the throttle, throttling back when the props are out of the water so you don't redline the engine and forward when reentering.  The swells are now four feet.  They launch off each, get airborne, cut into the next...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we get into Cuba?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My cousin is the harbor master. You must not bring in drugs.  You cannot be armed.  If you're carrying, it has to go.  Or stow it inside.  No one will go near your boat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do business in Cuba with your husband?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never do business in Cuba. (beat) And nobody goes to Cuba but me. (smiles) And he is not my husband... Crockett's surprised.  And he doesn't push it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you born in Havana?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angola.  My mother was being a surgeon there.  She volunteered. Mozambique and Mali, too... (over the wind) ...those days, in those days...she was part of Cuba's gift to the third world.  She came from a bourgeois family with a house in Verdado...we still have the house. We will go there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's she now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead... Crockett looks at her.  Her perspective is that of the '60's and '70's, the politics of national liberation, the perspective of Marcuse and Franz Fanon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angolan Military.  Went back to the fighting.  Disappeared.  Who knows...? Isabella looks at the look on Crockett's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead and ask...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's he not your husband?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am no one's wife.  I live in my own house.  I do not live in a man's house.  He has a wife.  We are together.  I am free.  Because of banking and finance and travel... (looks at him, shouts over wind) And I can do anything I want... She laughs.  She has that combination of intellect, beauty and youth.  Everything is possible...life will never end...she can ride this crest eternally. And Crockett knows that her confidence makes her oblivious to peril, makes "right now" too real because she believes she will live forever. CROCKETT can't help it.  He looks right at her.  She lifts her face to the spray.  Some clouds part and light strikes her... And Crockett wants to possess her; to protect her.  He wants no one else to have her.  He wants no harm to come to her. And this is an impulse that takes him over to the core of who he is.  And, as we MOVE IN CLOSER, Crockett has to turn away... ISABELLA sees this.  She's quizzical.  Crockett looks back at her. Their eyes connect. "BORN TO WIN" leaps... CROCKETT his left arm around her shoulder, his right on the wheel. She rocks back against his body.  They rip across the seas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts over noise) Mojitas...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting back) Later!  Do you dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dance... They move into the crowd under two-story high windows overlooking Meyer Lansky's Hotel Riviera - freeze-dried 1959 Las Vegas. CROCKETT + ISABELLA Whatever we knew about Sonny Crockett, we did not know he could dance.  Their feet, their knees and thighs, perfectly matched, they samba, like lightning. He swings her around and turns her to a close embrace as their hips and legs parallel each other's, as he turns her under his arm, stops her, pulls her backwards into his body, her hips into his, the fast beat, the footwork, and he spins her back facing him, pressing her closer as it gets faster and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My aunt.  She's ancient.  She looks after the place... (beat) This was my mother's family's home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I insist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flip) Okay. (beat) Macon, Georgia is where I was born. Wound up in a juvenile facility.  I was 14.  Then the military.  Then prison.  Because I was dumb and angry.  Then I read.  Then I got smart.  Then I discovered what I know, now...it's all business... Isabella smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bartender) My friend, two more. (beat) What was your mother's name...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blanca...a rubio like you. (pause) I see her in a dress...an old photograph from Lucinda somebody's wedding...everybody is with couples.  Husbands and wives.  They all pose.  My mother is alone because my father had to go back to the fighting. (she points) ...she looks right into the camera. She is the most beautiful woman in the room.  By herself.  In a party dress.  And she looked like she knew she would die alone... (beat...remembers) She spoke many languages.  We were in Luanda when she died.  I went to her friends in Mali.  They sent me to the Ecole Polytechnique in Geneva to study mathematics, where I met Montoya in the discos.  He had banking there...I was seventeen and very much into the clubs.  And he sent me to University for an MBA in Finance. (pause) Your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Died in childbirth, having me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To mothers.  And all that we owe them... Isabella looks at Crockett and smiles and puts on her sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how improbable this is...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Probable"...applies to an event that may be real.  Doesn't apply here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...'cause we have no future...are of today and not tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and therafore there is no consequence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Crockett's hand is around her waist and slips down her hip as he pulls her closer and takes off her glasses and she puts down her drink and kisses him at the bar and Crockett's eyes dwell on her and she looks back at him and, now, knowing what he's thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (soft) Let's talk deliveries. Isabella is not let down by the switch to commerce.  She merely goes there, too.  After all, this is their subject. Soft smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and a different kind of deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like "three thousand a ki?"  That's nice. And I can supply the transportation into South Florida and the Gulf, more reliable and on-time than FedEx.  But, three per ki was OK for openers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why should continuing excellence cost more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cost less.  That's the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it December?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Christmas come early this year...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better than that. (beat) We become partners.  Only in this territory and only on loads we run. And you don't pay us three thousand a ki.  You pay us zero.  Why we get is thirty percent of the load. Product or cash.  "And why," you're thinking, "would I be crazy enough to out in these gringos like that? Is he chipping?  Crazy for my love? Too many mojitas?"  And the answer is, "of course" but also "no.  It is because Sonny can deliver what no one else can."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good samba dancing...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero risk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause you don't lose loads?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause we guarantee every load. (beat) Anywhere, for any reason, it comes up short, we make good.  Your operations will, from now on, run risk-free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're our thirty-percent partner? Her knowing smile speaks of experience beyond her years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (deadly seriously) What if I tell you that your ideas are too big for your skin? (beat) That merely to propose this is a dangerous thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I would say to you, this has been fun... There's a long pause.  This is business.  This is what is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The range should be between fifteen and seventeen-point-five percent of the P.O.E....to even consider it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need thirty.  Calculate in, also, the cash you don't have to front...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Available cash is not an issue for us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-eight-point-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I pushed to twenty-one...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would say you're... (hesitates; holds up four fingers) ...four percentage points away from a deal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'm only one. And she slides into his arms.  And smiles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll do it at twenty-two... Isabella laughs.  She kisses him under the shower water.  And it's tough to know who is pushing it further out onto the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now I make you breakfast again... Her breathing is heavier as she buries her head in his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell are you, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) On my way back... Crockett disconnects.  He pushes it.  It launches from one swell, airborne, and knifes into the next.  It's violent. Crockett's thoughts and expression are about Isabella.  They are criminal conspirators, a woman cheating on her narcotrafficker "husband," an outlaw smuggler who's really an undercover cop... OVER CROCKETT:  GOVERNMENT CHANNEL - "BORN TO WIN" rockets in and then throttles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mutters) The meet with Castillo and the fed got set up.  It's in 45 minutes... Tubbs goes inside.  Crockett follows.  As he passes Gina...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up, Sonny...? Crockett looks at her.  He has no answer. INT. HOUSE - CROCKETT enters.  While Tubbs is strapping up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit a couple of jazz clubs.  Fell back to her place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Verdado.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Verdado where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's in the suburbs outside Havana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Havana, Cuba...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Havana, Louisiana. (beat) Don't we have a meet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...where you're makin' a move on the wife of Archangel de Jesus Montoya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not makin' a move on her...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're makin' moves on each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that makes it okay, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said, "go exploring"?  We want this staying on track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fujima) Who's the "we"?  There's you and there's us.  And all we got from you was bad intel.  "Low-level producer."  Yeah, right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Montoya.  We went to meet the village priest.  It turns into Alice in the fucking Vatican and here's the Pope...of the North Valle Colombia dope trade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His operations are kingpin size and first-class.  His security is ex- Eastern bloc, ex-SAS and Israelis. Their comms are satellite uplink with mainframe encryption, significant Sig Int and in their zones of activity, they have signal- jamming capability... Fujima is surprised...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  CIA-level stuff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what does that level of spending on first-class, private- sector infrastructure signify to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mega-tonnage and mega-cash flow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haiti and Puerto Rico.  Money through Dubai and Geneva maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their loads are poly-drug.  "E" from Holland, methamphetamine precursors from Jordan, Afghan "H." Mid-ocean transshipments.  His real business is:  he's a network.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we can illuminate part of it from the inside out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we want to change-up the mission statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (no) Identify and indict the white supremacist group of importers. End of story.  Everything else I'm hearing is speculation masquerading as intel... Crockett flips him a set of keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keys to the boat.  Go do this motherfucker yourself. Fujima looks at Castillo...who is this insubordinate prick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you talking to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's talking to you, bro. (beat) What he means to say is he is reluctant to abandon the penetration of a major narcotrafficking organization...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: Fujima) Hey, fuck him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chill out Sonny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're the ones doing the death- defying shit?  And he wants us to give that up?  For what? A chump-change bust so he can get his picture in The Miami Herald to impress the slug farm in DC...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Castillo) Control your men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm my own man.  And anytime you want to see how much man I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) That's.  It. Everybody shuts up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Tubbs) Where are you on this? We know Tubbs has doubts about Crockett's motives and methods, nevertheless...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Sonny.  110%.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then that's it. (to Fujima) Change the mission statement. Crockett stays in.  He keeps working up the ladder.  The local importers get a pass for the time being.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to talk to my ADO...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't, Jim. (beat) 'Cause if I close this down, you got nothing to make a phone call about.  And my guys don't have a week for a Feeb bureaucratic process.  Every hour longer they're in there, they risk exposure.  So, right here, right now, they're back in or I pull them out and close you down.  What's it going to be? Fujima nods acquiescence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. He leaves.  When he's out of earshot...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Crockett) You fuckin' better be right...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low) What is going on...?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As in...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is "undercover."  And there is "Which way is up?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I am in so deep I forgot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am asking.  You to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe...I have forgotten I am a cop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would never doubt you. This is the answer Crockett needed to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do you doubt I will slot anyone complicit in the death of Maria, Alonzo and those children? Anyone...whoever they are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I do not. And we know that might mean Isabella. EXT. MONTOYA COMPOUND, GUAJIRA PENINSULA, COLOMBIA - ISABELLA - NIGHT We are on a peninsula with palm trees.  A bluff dotted with a small forest of satellite dishes.  A ribbon of white-sand and beyond that is silver light off the water.  It is rural and futuristic at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...90- and 120-day futures with shorted Canadian and US dollars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and we're looking at Nigerian crude...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Precursor shipments from Ras Tanura and Ju'aymah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transshipped to a Malaysian container ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not French registry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've been targeted.  And Pakistani registry is too vulnerable to search and seizure right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jose doesn't like the deal in South Florida... Montoya's referring to Crockett.  Alarm bells go off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cuts in) Burnett? (shrugs) They want 22% of the value on loads they run into South Florida.  It's the Juarez cartel model. They guarantee the loads.  The upside is our risk goes to zero. That frees-up capital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what does your intuition tell you...? Is he suspicious?  Does he suspect Isabella and Crockett are lovers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My "intuition"...?  My intuition made him breakfast the other morning in Havana. Her lieson with Crockett is the last thing we expected to hear from Isabella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're serious.  They're cautious. They'll forgo a deal over a technicality of how a delivery's handled...they'd walk away, rather than compromise operational security...that's good. Montoya's thoughtful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they have to be watched closely...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good deal, like this with us, for Burnett will be good only temporarily.  He'll get restless because he believes nothing is forever.  Life is dust, make it while you can.  He's ambitious. Montoya appreciates her thoughtfulness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I predict a few good runs.  Then there'll be a renegotiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my girl... Montoya uses Isabella and her sexual allure to gather insight into the people he does business with.  That's part of their deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the next load, Jose wants to front them silver.  But they them in lead... (beat) He thinks they are wrong.  What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (revealing nothing) I think Jose suspects anybody he doesn't intimidate.  And people, who are good at what they do?  They have egos, too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (careful) What would you do...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (equally careful) I like the diminished risk.  It frees up capital reserves.  I like working with self-interested businessmen who are competent.  You can predict their behavior.... Montoya looks at her very carefully.  She stares right back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other hand...if what you wish, mi corazon, is la plumba...the lead?  Then let's do that.  Accept their deal.  After the load is received...we will close their eyes forever... She looks at Montoya squarely.  It hangs in the air.  In his strange process of decision-making, Montoya reaches a conclusion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's try a few runs with these partners, I think.  I will tell Jose... If Isabella is pleased, she doesn't show it.  Montoya continues to stare at her unwavering expression, frozen in stone.  He smiles, then, and starts to take off her clothes. He reaches for her hand and brings her to him.  She kisses him and he puts aside his cigar, pulls her face into his neck, and she runs her hands down him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hola, chica.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hola, viejo. He touches the side of her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't stop, bad man... As they continue, we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to an Assistant) Do you have him? Assistant nods.  Montoya takes the heavy handset...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jose, about the Americans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Spanish) They are "wrong."  I do not trust them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Spanish) Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Spanish) Too good at what they do, I don't know.  Something I don't like. They are wrong... Montoya thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Spanish) Isabella likes them.  We made their deal. Montoya hangs up.  Jose Yero looks at the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transshipment point is here at

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SAFE HOUSE - CROCKETT - NIGHT staring at his satellite cell.  Waiting.  He looks out the window at the passing river.  Soft voices from another room...probably Tubbs and Gina.  It's five in the morning. It rings.  He answers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

location: JOSE YERO IN A TINTED EXCURSION
result.heading: EXT.
PLASTIC-WRAPPED BRICKS OF COCAINE THAT CROCKETT AND TUBBS STOLE FROM SAL MAGUDA'S WAREHOUSE WHEN THEY BLEW UP HIS BOATS

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. AN EMPTY MANSION - JOSE YERO - DAY The empty mansion is on its own peninsula.  Through the windows we see a yacht and Crockett's 48' Stryker, its canopy open but without its racing supergraphics.  The mansion interior...all Beaumaniers limestone...is devoid of all furnishing.  They sit on white plastic garden chairs from Sears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: INT.
location: A HAVANA NIGHTCLUB JAMMED WITH PEOPLE

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. "JAZZ" - A HAVANA NIGHTCLUB JAMMED WITH PEOPLE - NIGHT 14-piece Afro-Cuban band.  IN THE PRESS OF dancers at a small table, Crockett and Isabella...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BEDROOM - CROCKETT + ISABELLA fall onto a bed, shedding the last of their clothes, making love in a house somewhere.  Beyond them is an open window to the ocean.  The sky turns red and grey but the water stays molten. Their eyes are open...because they're locked together the whole time and their faces are steady and urgently surprised because this is not language; not a symbol, not a representation of a thing.  Jesus Montoya is not here.  Miami is not here.  This is discovery.  This is fact.  They have discovered each other and have never felt like this about anyone before in their lives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HOUSE, BEDROOM - CROCKETT - MORNING His eyes open.  He wakes up.  Light and situation flood in. He does not know where he is.  He pulls on his pants. Barefoot, he walks to the window.  The interior is high- ceilinged with immaculately polished floors.  And Crockett looks around, a stranger in a stranger place. EXT. THE BALCONY - CROCKETT enters.  The paint on the outside of this house is peeling and patinaed with stain.  The yard is overgrown.  The stucco fence around the streamline deco facade is crumbling from weather and time... CROCKETT WATCHES THE OCEAN from the balcony of the futuristic villa in Verdado...  A futurism from 1939, peeling aqua, aging science fiction. Wherever we are in the world, this place is out of the stream, outside history.  And Isabella, this woman from a different world, enters, brings him an oversized cup of coffee.  In his trousers, Crockett drapes an arm across her shoulders and they stand in the air. CROCKETT hears voices from the interior.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BODEGUITA DEL MEDIO - CROCKETT + ISABELLA - AFTERNOON in the funky yellow restaurant drinking mojitas.  They've had lunch served to them at the bar.  Frosted glasses have sugar on the bottom and are loaded with crushed Cuban herbs.  The bartender has been there for 40 years.  Crockett and Isabella look like regulars.  They've served chicken and plantains. Like any restaurant, the people eating at the bar are the regulars.  They sit where Hemingway sat in the slow part of the afternoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. THE STREAMLINE HOUSE IN VEDADO - LEADEN SKIES - LATE AFTERNOON The water is like sheet metal as clouds allow only a sliver of light to illuminate the sea while rain greys-out most of it.  Minute crimson is a freighter heading to the stone harbor.  Fabric billows in the wind.  PULL BACK into the room to Crockett and Isabella... TWO NAKED BODIES ...one light skinned, the other brown, intertwine in the opiated moments after sensuality.  The afternoon half-light drapes parts of their bodies, making a relief against which their eyes hold each other's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SHOWER - CROCKETT - LATER focused elsewhere.  It's as if he's struggling to record the event of her in memory so she'll sustain there, because he compels himself to a different place, now.  Then, the shower curtain parts.  It startles him... ISABELLA enters.  She touches his back.  He turns to her with a smile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BOAT ON STORMY SEAS - DAY Crockett is alone.  Black skies mottled with grey. CROCKETT Rain and wind rip across his face.  He left Isabella in Havana. SATELLITE PHONE rings.  Crockett picks it up.  It's Tubbs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. INDIAN RIVER SAFE HOUSE - TUBBS - DAY sitting on the U-shaped jetty as we HEAR Crockett kill the engines, tying it off.  Gina stands halfway up the small lawn to the early 60's ranch house under tropical palms.  Tubbs' mood is dark.  As Crockett approaches, he looks blankly at Tubbs, offering no explanation...
dialogue.name: dialogue

location: ENGINE ROOM OF A TRAMP FREIGHTER SEIZED BY US CUSTOMS AND TIED-UP ON THE INDIAN RIVER
result.heading: INT.

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. ENGINE ROOM OF A TRAMP FREIGHTER SEIZED BY US CUSTOMS AND TIED-UP ON THE INDIAN RIVER - FBI RAC JAMES FUJIMA - DAY We've entered a secret meeting mid-argument.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FREIGHTER ON THE INDIAN RIVER - CROCKETT + TUBBS - NIGHT step across to a second ship among the dozens tied-up along the river.  Its crimson paint is peeling and it's been stripped of everything salvageable.  They're alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MASTER BEDROOM SUITE - ARCHANGEL DE JESUS MONTOYA- LONDONO in pajama top and boxer shorts, smoking a cigar.  In a sweatsuit is Isabella, delivering a financial report.  It's from memory.  Nothing is written down, in the tradition of the elite section of Swiss private banking in which clerks commit portfolios to memory.  There are no documents.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BARRANQUILLA, COLOMBIA AIRPORT - A G3 - NIGHT lands.  The door opens.  Isabella emerges.  CLOSER...she searches, looking for someone as she descends the ramp. Then... CROCKETT emerges from behind an SUV.  He came to meet her plane. ISABELLA'S expression changes, but she masks it. Businesslike, she walks across the tarmac.  There are two Suburbans.  One for her; one full of security.  Crockett and her meet.  No show of affection.  Her Secretary, carrying her briefcase, accompanies her towards the second Suburban. INT. SECOND SUBURBAN - DOOR - NIGHT opens.  Crockett and Isabella climb in.  The rear is customized cream leather, luxurious with three telephones and a divider.  As Isabella climbs in, followed by Crockett, she takes the briefcase from the Secretary and indicates he ride in the front vehicle.  Doors close.  Windows go up.  Air conditioning comes on.  She raises the divider, blocking the driver and locks the doors.  They are sealed in the back. Alone.  And she assaults Crockett with a passion that's desperate...as if making love to him puts her world back in balance.  Their clothes come off, Crockett pauses...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BARRANQUILLA NIGHTCLUB - TUBBS + GINA - NIGHT at the bar.  It's jammed.  "Cochi Loco" Yero and his permanent bodyguard, El Tiburon, pass, smile.  Tubbs introduces Yero to Gina, as his wife. Yero shakes Gina's hand.  He indicates to the bartender that Tubbs and Gina are to pay for nothing...and he moves towards an office.  Cobalt blue light illuminates his face, and his fierce yellow eyes are not filled with hospitality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FALS DE IGUAZU AIRPORT (THREE BORDERS AREA) - MONTOYA - NIGHT deplaning his G-4 crosses to his armored Suburban. INT. SUBURBAN - MONTOYA climbs into the back.  It's also a traveling communications center, satellite uplink, encryption, the works...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BARRANQUILLA CLUB, OFFICE - JOSE YERO JOSE YERO
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CLUB - CROCKETT + ISABELLA - NIGHT enter.  They join Tubbs and Gina. GINA sees Crockett's carriage with this woman.  It's different. Intuitively, she exchanges a look with Tubbs.  Crockett makes introductions.  Then, they move away to dance to a fast samba in perfect synchronicity.  And, they're also SEEN by... JOSE YERO He watches them, too.  His yellow eyes are lit by strobes. His eyes locked onto Isabella...dancing with Crockett, their bodies close... And in the way he looks at them, hurt, like a betrayed lover, which he isn't and never could have been...we know now, the core of his antagonism.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HONDURAN FREIGHTER, DINING AREA - TUBBS - DAY It's a 30 year old, well-maintained carribean freighter with a steel table and u-shaped bench.  In the dark interior, narrow spots reveal the group hovering over a ruggedized Workpad with navigational software.
dialogue.name: dialogue
